item.title: Authentication Validation
item.description:
1. Enable Access Control . Choose “Allow any valid User” as “Site Access”. Make sure any user is able to access the site.
  2. Enable Access Control . Choose “Restrict to Specific User” and add few users. Make sure only the specified users have access to the server. Others should get authentication error.
  3. Enable Access Control . Choose “Restrict to Specific User” and add a group. Make sure only all users belonging to the group have access to the server Others should get authentication error.
  4. Log in as a normal user (who has access to server but not a member of any environment) , a new default environment should be created for this user with this user account being the owner of the environment.Account entry should get created for this 1. user.
  5. Log in as a normal user (who has access to server) , create a new environment. This user should become the owner of the environment.
  6. As owner of environment , Add a user as “member” of an environment.Make sure this user gets access to this environment.
  7. As owner of environment , Add a user as “owner” of an environment.Make sure this user gets access to this environment. User should also have ability to manage this environment which is to add/delete member of the environment.
  8. As owner of environment , Add a group as “member” of an environment.Make sure that all users that belong to this group get access to the environment.
  9. As owner of environment , Add a group as “owner” of an environment.Make sure all users of the group gets access to this environment. User should also have ability to manage this environment which is to add/delete member of the environment.
  10. As owner of environment , change the role of a member of the environment from “owner” to “member”. Make sure his access control reflects this change.
  11. As owner of environment , change the role of a member of the environment from “member” to “owner”. Make sure his access control reflects this change.
  12. As owner of environment, remove an existing “owner” member of the environment.Make sure this user does not have access to environment anymore.
  13. As owner of environment, remove an existing “member” member of the environment.Make sure this user does not have access to environment anymore.
  14. As owner of environment, deactivate the environment. Members of the environment should have no access to environment. Owners should only be able to see in their manage environments but not list of active environments.
  15. As owner of environment, Activate a deactivated environment. Members of the environment should now have access to environment.
  16. As owner of environment, delete a deactivated environment.Members of the environment should not have access to environment. All hosts relating to the environment should be purged (only hosts created through docker-machine). Custom hosts will not be purged.
  17. As admin user, deactivate an existing account. Account should have no access to rancher server.
  18. As admin user, activate a deactivated account.Account should get back access to rancher server.
  19. As admin user, delete an existing account. Once account is purged, make sure that account is not a member of environments.
  20. Log in as a deleted account when account is still not purged.User should have no access to rancher server (like in deactivated state).
  21. Log in as a deleted account when account is purged.When user tries to log in , a new account entry will get created and it will not have any access to any existing environment this account had access to before the account was deleted.
  22. Delete a user that is a member of the project. List the member of the project , it should return the deleted as member of the project but should reflect the user as “unknown user”.
  23. As member user of environment, trying to add a member to environment should fail.
  24. As member user of environment, trying to delete an existing member to the environment should fail
  25. As member user of environment, trying to deactivate an environment should fail
  26. As member user of environment, trying to delete an environment should fail.
  27. As member user of environment, trying to change the role of an existing member to the environment should fail.
  28. As admin user, change account type of existing “user” to “admin”. Check that they have access to “Admin” tab.

Special Characters relating test cases:

  1. User name having special characters ( In this case user DN will have special characters)
  2. Group name having special characters( In this case group DN will have special characters)
  3. Password having special characters

Test the above 3 test cases , by having “required” site access set for user/group as applicable.

item.title: Change user password (e2e_fe)
item.description:
• Related issues: #1409 There’s no way to change user password in single cluster UI

Verification Steps

  1. Logged in with user
  2. Changed password
  3. Logged out
  4. Logged back in with new password
  5. Verified old password didn’t work

Expected Results

  1. Password should change and be accepted on new login
  2. Old password shouldn’t work

item.title: Create SSH key from templates page
item.description:
• Related issues: #1619 User is unable to create ssh key through the templates page

Verification Steps

  1. on a harvester deployment, navigate to advanced -> templates and click create
  2. Click create new under SSH section
  3. enter valid credentials and save

Expected Results

  1. SSH key should be created and show in the SSH key section

item.title: First Time Login (e2e_fe)
item.description:
1. After successful installation of Harvester using Iso, on navigating to UI, user should be prompted to change the password.
  2. Verify the password rules

Expected Results

  1. User should be able to login

item.title: Login after password reset (e2e_fe)
item.description:

Expected Results
